article.title: Justin Hawkins
article.text:
{{Artysta muzyczny infobox |nazwa = Justin Hawkins |nazwa oryginalna = |zdjęcie = Justin Hawkins of The Darkness 01.jpg |opis zdjęcia = Justin Hawkins w Ankkarock 2004 |alt zdjęcia = |imię i nazwisko = Justin David Hawkins{{Filmweb|osoba|446183|Justin Hawkins}} |pseudonim = |data urodzenia = 17 marca 1975{{IMDb|osoba|1510097|Justin Hawkins}} |miejsce urodzenia = [[Chertsey]]{{Discogs|artysta|413577|Justin Hawkins}}, [[Surrey]] |data śmierci = |miejsce śmierci = |instrument = [[gitara elektryczna]], [[instrument klawiszowy|instrumenty klawiszowe]], [[fortepian]], [[sitar]], [[syntezator]], [[minimoog]], [[organy Hammonda]] |typ głosu = |gatunek = [[hard rock]]{{cytuj stronę|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/the-darkness-p572345/biography|tytuł=The Darkness Biography|nazwisko=Rivadavia|imię=Eduardo |opublikowany=[[AllMusic]]|język=en|data dostępu=2011-03-15}}, [[heavy metal]] |zawód = |aktywność = od 2000 |wydawnictwo = [[Atlantic Records]]
[[Must Destroy]]
[[Barbecue Rock Records]] |powiązania = |współpracownicy = |wyróżniony instrument = |zespół = [[The Darkness]] (2000-2006, od 2011)
[[British Whale]] (od 2005)
[[Hot Leg]] (od 2008) |odznaczenia = |faksymile = |opis faksymile = |commons = |www = http://web.archive.org/web/20120723033508/http://teamhotleg.com/ }} '''Justin David Hawkins'''{{Cytuj stronę |url=http://www.listal.com/justin-hawkins|tytuł=Justin Hawkins|opublikowany =Listal|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}} (ur. [[17 marca]] [[1975 w muzyce|1975]] w [[Chertsey]]) – lider grupy [[Hot Leg]], frontman [[The Darkness]], zanim do niego dołączył grał w [[Vital Signs]]. Ukończył Huddersfield Technical [[College]]. Ma brata – Dana. Od 2005 roku prowadzi swój solowy projekt, British Whale. Jego styl ukształtowały przede wszystkim zespoły tworzące klasycznego [[hard rock]]a i [[glam metal]] w latach 70. i 80. XX wieku, takich jak [[Van Halen]], [[Led Zeppelin]], [[Queen]], [[Def Leppard]], [[Whitesnake]], [[Aerosmith]] czy [[AC/DC]]{{Cytuj stronę |url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/justin-hawkins-mn0001322080|autor=Jon O'Brien |tytuł=Justin Hawkins Biography & History|opublikowany =[[AllMusic]]|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}}. W 2006 roku piosenkarz został sklasyfikowany na 88. miejscu listy 100 najlepszych wokalistów wszech czasów według [[Hit Parader]]{{cytuj stronę | url = http://www.hearya.com/2006/12/04/hit-paraders-top-100-metal-vocalists-of-all-time/ | tytuł = Hit Parader’s Top 100 Metal Vocalists of All Time | opublikowany =Hearya.com | język = en | data dostępu = 2010-06-16}}{{Cytuj stronę| url = https://www.billboard.com/bbcom/news/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1003873151| tytuł = Justin Hawkins Starts Fresh With Hot Leg| opublikowany = [[Billboard (tygodnik)|Billboard]]| język = en| data dostępu = 2008-10-10| archiwum = https://web.archive.org/web/20081011161949/http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/news/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1003873151| zarchiwizowano = 2008-10-11}}. == Życiorys == === Wczesne lata === Urodził się w [[Chertsey]] w [[Surrey]] w Wielkiej Brytanii. Wkrótce wraz z rodziną przeniósł się do [[Suffolk]] w [[Lowestoft]], gdzie dorastał wraz z młodszym bratem Danem (ur. 12 grudnia 1976){{NNDB|osoba|243/000109913|Justin Hawkins}} i siostrą. W młodym wieku nauczył się grać na gitarze i innych instrumentach muzycznych. Uczęszczał do Kirkley High School, gdzie nakręcono program ''Rock School'' dla stacji [[Channel 4]], jednakże wszystkie nawiązania do Hawkinsa i jego ówczesnego zespołu The Darkness zostały usunięte, pomimo iż muzyk wspierał szkołę wartymi tysiące funtów instrumentami muzycznymi. Przerwał naukę tam przed zdaniem 'A' Levels (odpowiednik polskiej matury). Następnie studiował Music Technology w Huddersfield Technical College{{Cytuj stronę |url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/music/rockandjazzmusic/3612580/Hanging-out-with-the-Hawkins-boys-how-I-watched-the-dawn-of-the-Darkness.html|autor=Jamie Dickson (2004-02-19|tytuł=Hanging out with the Hawkins boys: how I watched the dawn of the Darkness|opublikowany=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}}. === Kariera === Miłość Hawkinsa do muzyki rockowej urosła w siłę podczas gdy grał w heavy metalowym zespole The Commander (jako Justin „Turbo” Hawkins, wraz z Rico Mussonem, Shaggym Forleyem, Davidem „Growy” Owensem, Jimem Lee i Richardem „Breaky” Bedfordem){{Cytuj stronę |url=https://www.theguardian.com/culture/2012/aug/23/darkness-justin-hawkins-30-minutes|autor=Paul Lester (2012-08-23|tytuł=The Darkness's Justin Hawkins: 'Contrary to expectations, you'd never catch me dogging'|opublikowany =[[The Guardian]]|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}}. Był solowym gitarzystą The Darkness, dopóki jego brat Dan nie zobaczył jego występu - interpretacji mimicznej do „[[Bohemian Rhapsody]]” zespołu [[Queen]] w [[The Swan]], w [[Beccles]], 31 grudnia 1999. Od tego czasu zaczęli używać potencjału Justina jako frontmana grupy, mimo że wciąż grał większość solówek gitarowych w zespole. Debiutancki albumu ''Permission To Land'' (2003){{Cytuj stronę |url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/showbiz/622646/The-Darkness-band-Justin-Hawkins-looks-totally-different-now|autor=Regan Okey (2017-06-16)|tytuł=Remember The Darkness frontman Justin Hawkins? He looks totally different now|opublikowany =Daily Star|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}} sprzedano w ilości 1,5 miliona{{Cytuj stronę |url=http://www.nme.com/blogs/nme-blogs/justin-hawkins-on-how-his-troubled-band-the-darkness-survived-sadness-drama-and-trauma-17497|autor=Lisa Wright (2015-04-28)|tytuł=Justin Hawkins On How His Troubled Band The Darkness Survived ‘Sadness, Drama And Trauma’|opublikowany =NME|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}} egzemplarzy w Wielkiej Brytanii. W 2005 Justin rozpoczął solowy projekt British Whale. Debiutancki singiel, „This Town Ain't Big Enough for Both of Us”, cover hitu grupy Sparks z 1974 roku, wydany 15 sierpnia osiągnął 6 miejsce na liście przebojów UK Singles Chart. W 2006 Justin wydał drugi singiel, który dostępny był tylko do ściągnięcia z sieci. Był to nieoficjalny hymn na Puchar Świata, zatytułowany „England”. W sierpniu 2006 ujawniono informację o uzależnieniu frontmana od alkoholu i narkotyków; informacja została potwierdzona przez managera zespołu The Darkness{{Cytuj stronę |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/6043810.stm|tytuł=Drugs force Darkness singer out|opublikowany =BBC|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}}. 11 października 2006 ujawnił, że po sukcesie odniesionym w 2003 przez singiel „I Believe In A Thing Called Love”{{Cytuj stronę |url=http://www.tmz.com/2017/06/15/justin-hawkins-the-darkness-singer-now-photos/|autor=AM (2017-06-15)|tytuł=The Darkness Singer Justin Hawkins 'Memba Him?!|opublikowany =TMZ.com|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}}, w ciągu trzech lat wydał ponad £150,000 na kokainę{{Cytuj stronę |url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/living/1274189/youll-never-guess-what-justin-hawkins-from-the-darkness-looks-like-now/|autor=George Harrison (2016-06-13)|tytuł=You’ll never guess what Justin Hawkins from The Darkness looks like now|opublikowany =[[The Sun]]|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}}. Kiedy zdał sobie sprawę, że nie ma już kontroli nad swoimi nałogami, poddał się kuracji odwykowej w renomowanej londyńskiej klinice The Priory{{Cytuj stronę |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/suffolk/5265092.stm|autor=GMT (2006-08-18)|tytuł=Darkness singer in rehab clinic|opublikowany=BBC News|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}}. W październiku 2006 Hawkins opuścił The Darkness{{Cytuj stronę |url=http://www.nme.com/news/the-darkness/24662|autor=|tytuł=Justin Hawkins quits The Darkness|opublikowany =NME|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}} i został zastąpiony na wokalach przez basistę Richiego Edwardsa{{Cytuj stronę|url=http://www.contactmusic.com/news.nsf/article/bassist%20takes%20over%20as%20darkness%20frontman_1017220|tytuł=Bassist Takes Over As Darkness Frontman|opublikowany=Contactmusic.com|język=en|data dostępu=2017-07-24|archiwum=https://web.archive.org/web/20090112195256/http://www.contactmusic.com/news.nsf/article/bassist%20takes%20over%20as%20darkness%20frontman_1017220|zarchiwizowano=2009-01-12}}. Zaśpiewał także chórki do coveru grupy [[Sweet (zespół muzyczny)|The Sweet]], „Hell Raiser”, nagranego przez [[Def Leppard]] w 2006 na ich album ''Yeah!''. W 2007 był jednym z 6 kandydatów do reprezentowania Wielkiej Brytanii na [[Konkurs Piosenki Eurowizji|konkursie Eurowizji]] w [[Helsinki|Helsinkach]]{{Cytuj stronę |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/6404193.stm|tytuł=Justin Hawkins enters race to become UK Eurovision entry|opublikowany =BBC|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}}, śpiewając w duecie z [[Beverlei Brown]]. Wspólnie zaśpiewali napisaną przez Justina piosenkę „They Don’t Make 'Em Like They Used To”, ale nie wygrali eliminacji. 16 marca 2007 Justin Hawkins pojawił się w [[Comic Relief]], transmitowanym podczas półgodzinnego programu ''[[Top Gear of the Pops]]''. Wykonał tam piosenkę [[Billy Ocean]], „Red Light Spells Danger”, wspólnie z prezenterami programu. 29 marca 2007 Justin stworzył nowy profil na portalu [[Myspace|MySpace]] zawierający między innymi piosenki które miały pojawić się na jego solowym albumie zatytułowanym ''Panther''. Były to utwory: „You Can't Hurt Me Anymore”, „I've Met Jesus” i „Whichever”. 12 maja Justin dodał kolejną piosenkę „Gay In The 80's”, która również miała pojawić się na tym albumie. 13 lipca wszystkie piosenki zostały usunięte, a na ich miejscu pojawiło się zdanie: ''Będziecie musieli poczekać'' (angielski oryginał: ''You'll Just Have to Wait''). Hawkins ogłosił także, że uczestniczył w nagraniu dwóch albumów grupy [[Magnet Watch]], zatytułowanych ''Nude Horizon'' i ''Party Party Time Time''. 8 listopada 2007 o 3:00 nad ranem Justin umieścił na [[Myspace|MySpace]] blog zawierający linki do organizacji Do the Green Thing, dla której skomponował utwór „Do It In The Dark”, który był podkładem muzycznym do krótkiego filmiku który zachęcałby ludzi do wyłączania światła i urządzeń elektrycznych i oszczędzania energii. Piosenka została wydana jako singiel, ale jest też dostępna do ściągnięcia za darmo. W 2008 Justin, wspólnie z Petem Rinaldim, Samuelem SJ Stokesem i Darbym Toddem założył zespół [[Hot Leg]], który supportował amerykańskie zespoły [[Alter Bridge]] i [[Extreme (zespół muzyczny)|Extreme]] podczas ich tras koncertowych po Wielkiej Brytanii. Zespół 20 października 2008 wydał pierwszy singiel, „Trojan Guitar”, zwiastujący płytę ''Red Light Fever'', która pojawiła się na sklepowych półkach w styczniu 2009 nakładem wytwórni Barbecue Rock Records. Premierę kolejnego singla zespołu, „I've Met Jesus” miała miejsce 15 grudnia 2008{{Cytuj stronę |url=https://www.discogs.com/Hot-Leg-Ive-Met-Jesus/release/1726974|tytuł=Hot Leg - I've Met Jesus (CDr)|opublikowany =Discogs|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}}. Hawkins użyczył swojego głosu i gry na gitarze dla „Kurtza”, wokalisty „bad guy band” Mantyz w serialu animowanym BBC ''[[Freefonix]]'', którego premiera była 4 stycznia 2008{{Cytuj stronę |url=http://web.archive.org/web/20080225173937/http://www.iomtoday.co.im:80/news/Isle-of-Man-cartoon-series.3634756.jp|tytuł=Isle of Man cartoon series goes on air|opublikowany =Isle of Man Today|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}}. W filmie ''Telestar'' (2008), opowiadającym o życiu i karierze [[Joe Meek|Joego Meeksa]], wystąpił jako [[Screaming Lord Sutch]]{{Cytuj stronę |url=http://wwww.filmow.com/justin-hawkins-a188760/|tytuł=Artista Justin Hawkins (17 de Março de 1975)|opublikowany =Filmow|język=pt|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}} u boku [[Kevin Spacey|Kevina Spacey]], [[Pam Ferris]] i [[James Corden|Jamesa Cordena]]. Pojawił się też w ''Psychosis'' (2010) jako Josh z [[Charisma Carpenter|Charismą Carpenter]]. Można było usłyszeć „Black Shuck” w komedii ''[[Szkoła rocka]]'' (2003), „Growing on Me” w komedii ''[[Jazda na maksa]]'' (2004), a „I Believe in a Thing Called Love” w ''[[Bridget Jones: W pogoni za rozumem]]'' (2004) i serialu ''[[Glee]]'' (2014). W 2011 Hawkins wraz z członkami oryginalnego składu [[The Darkness]] wznowił działalność zespołu{{Cytuj stronę |url=http://web.archive.org/web/20130601115644/http://www.cgm.pl:80/aktualnosci,14564,the_darkness_potwierdzaja_reaktywacje,news.html|tytuł=The Darkness potwierdzają reaktywację|opublikowany =cgm.pl|język=pl|data dostępu= 2011-03-15}}. Stał się znany z noszenia kocich kombinezonów (catsuits) i kwiecistości{{Cytuj stronę |url=https://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1144202/Return-prince-Darkness-Justin-Hawkins-king-catsuits-new-band-regrets-Eurovision.html|autor=Adrian Thrills (2009-02-13)|tytuł=Return of the prince of Darkness: Justin Hawkins, king of catsuits, has a new band and no regrets (except Eurovision)|opublikowany =[[Daily Mail]]|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}}. W październiku 2014 próbował sprzedawać swoje stare kombinezony w serwisie [[eBay]]. 27 maja 2015 ukazał się czwarty krążek w karierze The Darkness ''The Last Of Our Kind''{{Cytuj stronę |url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/the-darkness-mn0000141683/discography|autor=|tytuł=The Darkness Album Discography|opublikowany =[[AllMusic]]|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}}, który promował rysunkowy teledysk do singla "Barbarian". == Życie prywatne == W latach studenckich (1995-97) był związany z Kathryn Biddle{{Cytuj stronę |url=http://www.glamourmagazine.co.uk/article/his-darkest-secrets|tytuł=His Dark Secrets|opublikowany=[[Glamour]]|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}}. Od 2000 roku spotykał się menadżerką Sue Whitehouse, którą poślubił w 2004 roku, mają córkę Charlotte. Związany był też z Jennifer Stephens (2003-2004) i Heleną Linder (2010). 18 października 2012 roku ożenił się z Sarah Hawkins{{Cytuj stronę |url=http://web.archive.org/web/20151025192556/http://rollingstoneaus.com/music/post/justin-hawkins-the-darkness-ill-just-take-my-clothes-off-and-start-crying/1836|autor=Rod Yates (2015-06-23)|tytuł=Justin Hawkins, The Darkness: “I’ll Just Take My Clothes Off and Start Crying”|opublikowany =[[Rolling Stone]]|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}}{{Cytuj stronę |url=http://www.famousfix.com/topic/justin-hawkins/dating |tytuł=Justin Hawkins Dating History|opublikowany =FamousFix|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}}{{Cytuj stronę |url=https://www.thoughtco.com/the-darkness-justin-hawkins-new-look-not-disguise-2897696|autor=Bob Schallau (2015-07-16)|tytuł=Interview With The Darkness Frontman Justin Hawkins|opublikowany=ThoughtCo|język=en|data dostępu= 2017-07-24}}. == Przypisy == {{Przypisy}} {{Kontrola autorytatywna}} {{SORTUJ:Hawkins, Justin}} [[Kategoria:Brytyjscy gitarzyści rockowi]] [[Kategoria:Brytyjscy keyboardziści]] [[Kategoria:Brytyjscy sitarzyści]] [[Kategoria:Brytyjscy wokaliści rockowi]] [[Kategoria:Urodzeni w 1975]]

article.title: Justin Hawkins
article.text:
{{BLP sources|date=August 2010}}
{{Use British English|date=December 2012}}
{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2019}}
{{Infobox musical artist
| background       = solo_singer
| name             = Justin Hawkins
| image            = Justin Hawkins Dublin Academy 27 11 19.jpg
| caption          = Justin Hawkins playing live with The Darkness on the Easter Is Cancelled tour, Dublin 27/11/19
| birth_date       = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1975|3|17}}
| birth_place      = [[Chertsey]], Surrey, England
| death_date       = 
| birth_name       = Justin David Hawkins
| occupation       = {{flatlist|

}}
| genre            = {{flatlist|

}}
| instrument       = {{flatlist|

* [[Hot Leg]]

}}
| label            = {{flatlist|
* [[Cooking Vinyl]]

| website          = {{URL|http://www.thedarknesslive.com/}}
}}
'''Justin David Hawkins''' (born 17 March 1975) is an English musician, singer and songwriter, best known for being the lead singer and lead guitarist of [[The Darkness (band)|the Darkness]]. Heavily influenced by classic rock bands of the 1970s and 1980s (particularly [[Queen (band)|Queen]], [[Aerosmith]], [[Def Leppard]] and [[AC/DC]]), Hawkins is noted for his [[falsetto]] singing voice and flamboyant on-stage persona. He was also the lead singer and guitarist for the band [[Hot Leg]], formed in 2008, and now on hiatus. His falsetto voice has been described as [[operatic]] and very similar to [[Queen (band)|Queen]]'s [[Roger Taylor (Queen drummer)|Roger Taylor]].

==Music career==

===The Darkness===
{{main|The Darkness (band)}}
Hawkins began playing clubs and pubs with the Darkness until they were signed by record label [[Atlantic Records]]. Their debut album, ''[[Permission to Land]]'', went straight to number two in the UK charts upon its release on 7 July 2003, before going to number one and staying there for four weeks, eventually going on to sell 1.5 million copies in the UK. 3.5m copies over all.<ref name=guardian>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2008/sep/20/popandrock5|title=Rock on'|author=Alexis Petridis|work=The Guardian|access-date=27 September 2014|archive-date=15 December 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181215095502/https://www.theguardian.com/music/2008/sep/20/popandrock5|url-status=live}}</ref> The Darkness took inspiration for some of their work from the local north Suffolk area, including "Black Shuck" which mentions the nearby village of [[Blythburgh]]. The success of this album led to heavy touring for the band, including European portions of [[Metallica]]'s Summer Sanitarium Tour 2003. They then went on to headline the [[Carling Festival]] in 2004. The band won three [[BRIT Awards]] in 2004 in response to the album, ''Best Group'', ''Best Rock Group'' and ''Best Album''. They also won two [[Kerrang!]] awards in 2004 for ''Best Live Act'' and ''Best British Band''. The third single from the album, "[[I Believe in a Thing Called Love]]", was a substantial hit in the UK as was their tilt at the Christmas 2003 number 1, "[[Christmas Time (Don't Let the Bells End)]]", which only just fell short, both singles reaching No.2 in 2003.  The band also appeared in the video "Band Aid 20" with Justin singing a number of lines.

[[File:DarknessLive.jpg|right|200px|thumb|upright|Justin Hawkins performs live with the Darkness]]
By late 2004 the band's constant media coverage had started to lead to a general public backlash, and Hawkins and the band themselves seemed to show signs that they were disillusioned with their constant media appearances, infamously walking off of an episode of the U.S.-nationally syndicated radio talk show ''[[Loveline]]'' on 19 April 2004.

In October 2005, a month before the album ''[[One Way Ticket to Hell... And Back]]'' was to be officially released, Hawkins won an [[eBay]] auction for a copy of ''One Way Ticket to Hell... and Back'' for £350 under the username 'turbogunhawk'. He claimed he did this so that he could track down whoever sold the digitally-marked advance copy of the album and try to prevent it from happening again.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://theage.com.au/news/breaking/band-buys-own-album-from-ebay/2005/11/10/1131578152968.html|title=UK band buys own album from eBay|publisher=Theage.com.au|access-date=27 September 2014|archive-date=10 June 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610150520/http://www.theage.com.au/news/breaking/band-buys-own-album-from-ebay/2005/11/10/1131578152968.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

"One Way Ticket", the first single from their second album, was released on 14 November 2005, debuting and peaking at number 8 on the UK Singles chart.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.officialcharts.com/artist/12440/darkness/|title=The Darkness | full Official Chart History | Official Charts Company|website=Officialcharts.com|access-date=14 July 2020|archive-date=20 September 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200920003707/https://www.officialcharts.com/artist/12440/darkness/|url-status=live}}</ref> The album itself was released on 28 November 2005, to somewhat mixed reviews. The album was produced by rock producer [[Roy Thomas Baker]], best known for his work with [[Queen (band)|Queen]]. Early sales figures in the UK showed the album had not sold as well its predecessor, ''[[Permission to Land]]''. The album debuted at no. 11, and fell to number 34 in the second week of its release. Although it went on to achieve platinum status, this was in stark contrast with their debut's five times platinum status.
[[File:The Darkness Glasgow SECC.jpg|thumb|right|200px|The Darkness live in [[Glasgow]], February 2006]]
The second single taken from their second album was "Is It Just Me?", released on 20 February 2006. The single gained a preliminary position of No. 6 all that week, but finally charted at number 8. Hawkins announced when on stage that their third single to be released from the album was "[[Girlfriend (The Darkness single)|Girlfriend]]". Released 22 May, "Girlfriend" charted at number 39.

The band followed up their second album with a tour of the UK and Ireland, consisting of 12 dates in the major cities. The tour opened in Dublin's [[Point Theatre|Point Depot]] on 4 February and closed in the Nottingham Arena on 20 February. Few of the venues sold out, their appeal seemingly having become more selective. Their world tour, which followed, arrived in Australia and Japan after touring Scandinavia and Continental Europe in March.

In October 2006, Hawkins left the Darkness.<ref>{{cite news |title=Justin Hawkins quits The Darkness |url=http://www.nme.com/news/the-darkness/24662 |work=NME |date=11 October 2006 |access-date=11 October 2006 |archive-date=3 March 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303194652/http://www.nme.com/news/the-darkness/24662 |url-status=live }}</ref> Although drug and alcohol problems were initially cited as the main reason, later on national television, Hawkins would claim that he had grown tired of the constant routine of the band, recording and promoting an album, going on tours for months, back in the studio, etc. which he considered "monotonous and boring" and "could not understand how bands like the [[Rolling Stones]] could sustain it".<ref>''This Morning'', ITV, 2007</ref> For his time with the Darkness, Hawkins placed at number 35 on ''[[Spin (magazine)|Spin]]''{{'s}} list of the greatest [[frontmen]] of all time.

In 2011 the band reunited and toured [[Europe]], [[Asia]] and [[North America]] throughout 2011 and 2012 in support of their new album ''[[Hot Cakes]]''. They then released ''[[Last of Our Kind|Last Of Our Kind]]'' in 2015.

The band returned in 2017 with ''[[Pinewood Smile]],'' their first album to come through [[Cooking Vinyl]]. Ahead of the album's announcement, The Darkness toured Europe in support of Guns N' Roses and played a number of festivals in the UK and Europe during the summer. In 2018, they released their ''Live At Hammersmith'' album.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://cookingvinyl.com/artists/the-darkness/|title=The Darkness|website=Cooking Vinyl|language=en-GB|access-date=2020-01-16|archive-date=16 January 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200116135425/http://cookingvinyl.com/artists/the-darkness/|url-status=live}}</ref>

2019 saw The Darkness release the album ''[[Easter Is Cancelled]]'' on 4 October; the album charted in the top 10 in the UK.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.thedarknesslive.com/2020/01/the-darkness-release-in-another-life-video-ft-abbey-clancy/|title=The Darkness release 'In Another Life' video ft. Abbey Clancy|date=2020-01-09|website=The Darkness|language=en-GB|access-date=2020-01-16|archive-date=16 January 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200116135428/http://www.thedarknesslive.com/2020/01/the-darkness-release-in-another-life-video-ft-abbey-clancy/|url-status=live}}</ref>

In January 2020, The Darkness released a new video for "In Another Life", which featured model [[Abbey Clancy]]. The track then made the [[BBC Radio 2]] B-List.

===Other projects===
In 2005, Hawkins set up a solo project, called '''British Whale'''. His debut single, "[[This Town Ain't Big Enough for Both of Us]]", a cover of the 1974 hit by [[Sparks (band)|Sparks]], was released on 15 August, reached No. 6 on the [[UK Singles Chart]] and featured multiple World Darts Champion [[Phil Taylor (darts player)|Phil Taylor]] in the video. In 2006 Hawkins released a second single, available only to download, an unofficial [[FIFA World Cup|World Cup]] anthem called "England".

Hawkins sang backing vocals on [[The Sweet|Sweet]]'s song "Hell Raiser" for [[Def Leppard]]'s 2006 covers album ''[[Yeah! (Def Leppard album)|Yeah!]]''.<ref>{{cite web |title=Def Leppard Tour History - YEAH! |url=http://www.deflepparduk.com/album14.html |publisher=DefLeppardUK.com |access-date=16 December 2012 |archive-date=4 November 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131104035025/http://deflepparduk.com/album14.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

In early 2007, he became half of one of six acts competing to represent the UK in the [[Eurovision Song Contest]] competition in [[Helsinki]] in a duet with singer [[Beverlei Brown]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/6404193.stm |title=Justin Hawkins enters race to become UK Eurovision entry |publisher=BBC News |date=28 February 2007 |access-date=13 April 2012 |archive-date=23 March 2007 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070323130639/http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/6404193.stm |url-status=live }}</ref> He entered ''[[Making Your Mind Up (TV series)|Making Your Mind Up]]'' with [[Beverlei Brown]] singing a song entitled "They Don’t Make 'Em Like They Used To"<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio2/eurovision/2007/mymu/hawkinsandbrown.shtml|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070312201221/http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio2/eurovision/2007/mymu/hawkinsandbrown.shtml|url-status=dead|title=BBC|archive-date=12 March 2007|access-date=14 July 2020}}</ref> but did not win the competition.

On 16 March 2007, he appeared on the [[Comic Relief (charity)|Comic Relief]] evening during the half-hour [[Top Gear of the Pops]] programme.  This saw him performing [[Billy Ocean]]'s "Red Light Spells Danger" with the three [[Top Gear (current format)|Top Gear]] presenters.

Later that month, on 29 March, Hawkins created a new [[Myspace]] profile featuring songs that were planned to be included on his upcoming solo album entitled ''Panther''. The songs are titled "You Can't Hurt Me Anymore", "I've Met Jesus" and "Whichever". On 12 May, Hawkins added a further song to his profile, "Gay in the 80's", to appear on the same album. Later, on 13 July, he removed all the songs, and mentioned "You'll just have to wait".{{clarify|reason=Is this a song title or a statement?|date=December 2011}}  He later announced a new band line-up and name: [[Hot Leg]]. The aforementioned songs featured on the Hot Leg album ''[[Red Light Fever (Hot Leg album)|Red Light Fever]]''.
[[File:Hot Leg Dundee Doghouse 2008.jpg|thumb|left|300px|Hawkins with new band [[Hot Leg]], October 2008]]
Hawkins also announced that he had been participating in the recording of two Magnet Watch albums entitled ''Nude Horizon'' and ''Party Party Time Time''. On 8 November 2007, at 3:00 am, Hawkins posted a MySpace blog containing directions to Do the Green Thing, an organisation for which he has composed a new song, "Do It in the Dark", to accompany a short film that encourages people to switch off and save energy. The song has not been released as a single but is available as a free download.

There is a wax model of Hawkins at [[Madame Tussaud]]'s in London.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tussauds.com/media_centre/press_release.asp?id=23 |title=Do you rock – or not? |access-date=12 April 2007 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061124202535/http://www.tussauds.com/media_centre/press_release.asp?id=23 |archive-date=24 November 2006 }}</ref>

Hawkins supplied the singing and guitar playing for Kurtz, the lead singer of the "bad guy band" Mantyz in the BBC's animated series ''[[Freefonix]]'', which debuted on 4 January 2008.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.iomtoday.co.im/news/Isle-of-Man-cartoon-series.3634756.jp |title=Isle of Man cartoon series goes on air |publisher=Isle of Man Today |date=2 January 2008 |access-date=13 April 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080225173937/http://www.iomtoday.co.im/news/Isle-of-Man-cartoon-series.3634756.jp |archive-date=25 February 2008 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>

In the film ''[[Telstar (film)|Telstar]]'', a film about [[Joe Meek]]'s life and career that was released on 19 June 2009, he played the role of [[Screaming Lord Sutch]].<ref>{{IMDb name|1510097|Justin Hawkins}}</ref>

With [[Hot Leg]] in November 2008, he toured the UK supporting [[Alter Bridge]] ( 4–13 November) and [[Extreme (band)|Extreme]] ( 14–24 November).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1043813/justin-hawkins-starts-fresh-with-hot-leg |title=Justin Hawkins Starts Fresh With Hot Leg |work=Billboard |date=10 October 2008 |access-date=13 April 2012 |archive-date=12 September 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140912043742/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1043813/justin-hawkins-starts-fresh-with-hot-leg |url-status=live }}</ref>

Hawkins has also worked with British pop-rock band [[Saving Aimee]], having recently completed producing their debut album. He also lent his "truth larynx" to the track "Party All Day (Fuck All Night)" guesting on the 2009 [[Steel Panther]] release, ''[[Feel the Steel]]''. Hawkins recently worked with [[Adam Lambert]] on the track "Music Again" off his debut album.

Justin played the role of Josh, a burned out rockstar in the 2010 movie ''[[Psychosis (film)|Psychosis]]''. The movie also featured three Hot Leg songs.

Hawkins also appeared on the [[Meat Loaf]] album ''[[Hang Cool Teddy Bear]]'', where he co-wrote two songs ("Love Is Not Real" and "California Isn't Big Enough"). He also provided guitar on "California Isn't Big Enough" and backing vocals on "Love Is Not Real" and "Los Angeloser".

In 2012, Hawkins appeared in a [[Samsung]] commercial for their [[Samsung Galaxy Note (original)|Galaxy Note]] smartphone during [[Super Bowl XLVI]].<ref>{{cite web|title=The Darkness in Super Bowl Commercial |url=http://hardrockhideout.com/2012/02/05/the-darkness-in-superbowl-commercial/ |publisher=Hard Rock Hideout |access-date=16 March 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120724113814/http://hardrockhideout.com/2012/02/05/the-darkness-in-superbowl-commercial/ |archive-date=24 July 2012 |date=5 February 2012 |url-status=dead }}</ref> In the same year, Hawkins and brother [[Dan Hawkins (musician)|Dan]] appeared in the [[ZingZillas]] episode Electric Guitar.

In 2016, Hawkins appeared on the De La Soul album ''[[and the Anonymous Nobody...]]'' providing vocals on the track "Lord Intended".

In 2020, Hawkins participated in the [[The Masked Singer (British TV series)|UK version]] of ''[[The Masked Singer]]'', appearing as Chameleon. His identity was revealed in the third episode when he was voted out.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=sWKKSBIra0g|title=Chameleon Is JUSTIN HAWKINS! : Season 1 Ep.3 Reveal : The Masked Singer UK|publisher=[[YouTube]]|access-date=2020-07-14|archive-date=10 January 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210110002934/https://www.youtube.com/watch?app=desktop&v=sWKKSBIra0g|url-status=live}}</ref> During his time on the show he performed renditions of "[[Creep (Radiohead song)|Creep]]" by [[Radiohead]], "[[Feel It Still]]" by [[Portugal. The Man]], and "[[True Colors (Cyndi Lauper song)|True Colors]]" by [[Cyndi Lauper]].

== Personal life ==
{{expand section|date=March 2020}}
Hawkins is a [[Veganism|vegan]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://shootingstarproductions.co.uk/management/|title=Management|website=Shooting Star Productions|language=en-GB|access-date=2020-01-16|archive-date=16 January 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200116135430/https://shootingstarproductions.co.uk/management/|url-status=live}}</ref> He resides in Switzerland with his wife and daughter.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2020-01-12|title=Justin Hawkins' career, wife and net worth as he appears on The Masked Singer|url=https://metro.co.uk/2020/01/12/justin-hawkins-career-wife-net-worth-darkness-best-known-songs-appears-masked-singer-12043811/|access-date=2020-07-26|website=Metro|language=en|archive-date=26 July 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200726001854/https://metro.co.uk/2020/01/12/justin-hawkins-career-wife-net-worth-darkness-best-known-songs-appears-masked-singer-12043811/|url-status=live}}</ref> Hawkins supported [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] growing up, but he is primarily a supporter of [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.canaries.co.uk/News/2019/october/justin-hawkins-when-norwich-city-do-well-the-darkness-does-well/|title=Justin Hawkins: When Norwich City do well, The Darkness does well|website=Norwich City F.C. |date=2 October 2019|access-date=2 February 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42445075 |title=Premier League Boxing Day predictions: Lawro v The Darkness singer Justin Hawkins|website=BBC Sport |date=27 December 2017 |access-date=2 February 2021}}</ref>

==Equipment==
[[File:The Darkness, La Laiterie, Strasbourg - 49746121698.jpg|thumb|Justin Hawkins in 2020]]
Hawkins is seen playing [[Gibson Les Paul Custom]]s almost exclusively. He is most commonly seen playing an alpine white model which he used with the Darkness (as seen in the "[[I Believe in a Thing Called Love]]" & "[[Love is Only a Feeling]]" music videos), and with Hot Leg. It is rare to see him use another guitar, although he can be seen playing a custom [[Ibanez Jem]] for the song "Bald". He has also been seen using an ebony Gibson Les Paul Custom, a one-off Gibson "Less Paul" custom sculpted to resemble a shell, and a custom finished blue Les Paul standard airbrushed with the mythical dog Black Shuck and Blythburgh church. In 2004 [[Gibson Guitar Corporation|Gibson]] issued a limited run of Justin Hawkins signature Les Paul Customs based on the '68 RI with abalone and mother of pearl "flame" inlays on the fretboard, a sparkle finish in either Silverburst or Pinkburst (a Blueburst and Redburst have also been pictured, as well as a one-off Gold Mirror finish produced by SimS Custom Guitars). These have become highly valuable because of their scarcity and unique features.

Hawkins used [[Mesa Boogie]] dual and triple rectifier amplifiers rather than [[Marshall Amplification]] when performing with the Darkness. The stacks he was using had custom-made speaker cabs coated in red leather. During his time in [[Hot Leg]] he was exclusively seen using Cornford MK50H II's in white vinyl with two Cornford, 16-ohm, 4x12 cabinets loaded with Celestion "Vintage 30s". Since the Darkness reformation he has been seen using multiple modified [[Marshall 1959]] MKII Plexi Reissue guitar amps with a boosted gain stage run through Marshall 1960B cabinets. Since 2016, Hawkins uses EVH and Wizard amplifiers.<ref name="auto">{{Citation|last=Premier Guitar|title=Rig Rundown - The Darkness|date=24 May 2016|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vp0I2ZKVwjk|access-date=14 January 2018|archive-date=27 June 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180627204545/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vp0I2ZKVwjk|url-status=live}}</ref>

In a 2012 edition of ''[[Guitarist (magazine)|Guitarist Magazine's]]'' video series "On the Road with..." Hawkins's pedal setup consisted of a [[Boss Corporation|Boss]] Analog Delay, a [[Pro Co RAT]], a Diamond Pedals Compressor, a Boss TU-3 Tuner, and a [[Dunlop Cry Baby]] DCR-2SR rack module which allows him to have three separate [[wah-wah pedal]]s strategically placed around the stage. As of 2016, Hawkins does not use any pedals.<ref name="auto"/>

On the song "[[Girlfriend (The Darkness song)|Girlfriend]]", Hawkins uses a Moog [[Keytar]] for the solo.
